json\\common\\insider-relationship-vocab.title: Insider Relationship Vocab
json\\common\\insider-relationship-vocab.description: Vocabulary for the possible types of relationships between multiple insiders or between insiders and external accomplices

relationship.description: The insider's relationship to the other insider or to the accomplice at the time of the incident. If multiple, choose the strongest tie (e.g., "Friend" over "Colleague".

oneOf.title: Acquaintance
oneOf.description: Persons known to each other but not otherwise close

oneOf.title: Colleague
oneOf.description: Working together on the same team, department, or organization

oneOf.title: Former Colleague
oneOf.description: Formerly worked together on the same team, department, or organization

oneOf.title: Friend
oneOf.description: An ongoing close and/or friendly relationship

oneOf.title: Relative
oneOf.description: Members of the same family (immediate or extended)

oneOf.title: Significant Other/Legal partner
oneOf.description: Spouse, boyfriend, girlfriend, common law partner, or similar

oneOf.title: Unknown
oneOf.description: The type of relationship is unknown

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: The type of relationship is known, but not listed in this vocabulary

json\\objects\\accomplice.title: Accomplice
json\\objects\\accomplice.description: An accomplice is an outsider who conspired with the insider(s) to accomplish the objectives of the incident. An accomplice was not part of the victim organization at the time of the incident. An insider may have one or more accomplices. An accomplice may have one or more jobs (job history).

id.description: A unique string that begins with "accomplice--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

relationship_to_insider.description: The type of relationship between this accomplice and the insider to whom they are connected

json\\objects\\bundle.title: Bundle
json\\objects\\bundle.description: A bundle holds the objects relating an incident, (i.e., court cases, insider, targets, and impacts).

id.description: A unique identifier for the bundle

json\\objects\\charge.title: Charge
json\\objects\\charge.description: A charge is an accusation brought against the insider when the incident is pursued in the legal system. For example, "two counts of unauthorized access to company systems." A charge must be connected to only one court case. A court case may have one or more charges.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "charge--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

title.description: Broad subject matter area of the legal code. For U.S. cases, these are often titled "18 U.S.C."

section.description: Section (and subsection) of the law that the subject is accused of violating. For U.S. cases, for example, wire fraud is section 1343 of Title 18.

nature_of_offense.description: Description of the title and section of the law being violated

count.description: Number of times the subject is accused of violating the law associated with this charge. Note that multiple violations of a law are often listed as a range of counts (e.g., 'Count 2-6' would have count=5 for this property).

plea.description: Plea entered by the defendant for this charge

plea_bargain.description: Whether the charge indicated here is a lesser charge based on a previous plea agreement

disposition.description: The decision in the case or the final result

oneOf.title: Guilty
oneOf.description: The defendant pleaed guilty to the charge

oneOf.title: No Contest
oneOf.description: The defendant did not contest to the charge

oneOf.title: Not Guilty
oneOf.description: The defendant pleaded not guilty to the charge

oneOf.title: Refused to Enter a Plea
oneOf.description: The defendant refused to enter into a plea to the charge

oneOf.title: Acquitted
oneOf.description: Found not guilty by a court of law in a criminal trial

oneOf.title: Convicted
oneOf.description: Pleaded or found guilty by a court

oneOf.title: Dismissed
oneOf.description: The court or prosecutor decided the charge should not go forward

oneOf.title: Diversion/Deferred Prosecution
oneOf.description: The court delayed prosecution pending the successful completion of a treatment program, at which point the charges will be dismissed

oneOf.title: Expunged
oneOf.description: The deletion of non-conviction information (such as arrest data)

oneOf.title: No charges filed/Charges dropped
oneOf.description: The prosecutor declined to pursue the case

oneOf.title: Pending
oneOf.description: The case is still being investigated or prosecuted

oneOf.title: Pled down
oneOf.description: Pled guilty to a lesser charge

oneOf.title: Sealed
oneOf.description: The court has restricted access to all or some of the content of the record; however, the existence of the record will still be public record

oneOf.title: Suspended sentence
oneOf.description: The court has delayed the sentencing pending the successful completion of a period of probation and/or treatment program

oneOf.title: Vacated
oneOf.description: The court has withdrawn the guilty plea or set aside the guilty verdict, and the defendant may state they have never been convicted of that crime

json\\objects\\court-case.title: Court Case
json\\objects\\court-case.description: Court Case contains information about legal proceedings related to the incident, whether it is charges against the insider or their accomplice(s), a civil suit, or a suit against another entity involved in the incident. A legal response can have one or more court cases, and a court case MUST be tied to only one legal response. Each court case can have one or more charges and one or more sentences.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "court-case--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

case_number.description: A case number assigned by the court system in which the case is being tried

case_title.description: Title provided by the court system (e.g., 'USA v. LastName' or 'USA v. LastName, et al.')

court_country.description: Country where the case was tried

court_state.description: State or region where the case was tried

court_district.description: District where the case was tried, if applicable (e.g., "CA Central District Court")

court_type.description: Type or level of the court where the case is tried

defendant.description: The names of all the defendants (or respondents or appellees) in the case

plaintiff.description: The names of all the plaintiffs (or petitioners or appellants) in the case

comment.description: Clarifying comments about any of the court case details, or its associated charges and sentences, such as concurrent sentences, the structure of a plea deal, or the status of the case

oneOf.title: Federal
oneOf.description: Top level government court

oneOf.title: International
oneOf.description: Intergovernmental level court

oneOf.title: State
oneOf.description: State or regional level government court

oneOf.title: Civil
oneOf.description: A case dealing with a dispute between two people or organizations

oneOf.title: Criminal
oneOf.description: A case dealing with a violation of criminal law

json\\objects\\detection.title: Detection
json\\objects\\detection.description: Detection describes details about how, when, and by whom the incident was detected. An incident may have only one detection entity.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "detection--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

first_detected.description: The date and time the victim organization first became aware of the incident

who_detected.description: The individual entities or team(s) that first detected the incident

detected_method.description: The system or process that led to the first detection of the incident

logs.description: The type(s) of logs used by the detection team and/or method used to first detect the incident

comment.description: Clarifying comments about who, what, when, or how the incident was detected

anyOf.title: Law Enforcement
anyOf.description: Law enforcement discovered the insider's illegal activity (e.g., police noticed that the insider was gaining access to the company after hours)

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: The victim organization discovered the insider's activity (e.g., IT noticed that the insider had downloaded dozens of company trade secrets to their workstation)

anyOf.title: Customer
anyOf.description: A customer of the victim organization discovered the insider's activity

anyOf.title: Competitor
anyOf.description: An organization competing with the victim organization discovered the insider's activity (e.g., the insider approached a competing organization with company trade secrets, and the competitor alerted the victim organization)

anyOf.title: Auditor
anyOf.description: Internal or external auditor assigned to assess the organization's security, risk, or threat posture

anyOf.title: Self-Reported
anyOf.description: The insider reported their activity to their organization

anyOf.title: Incident Response Team
anyOf.description: The incident response team (IRT) discovered the insider's activity

anyOf.title: Security Team
anyOf.description: Technical or personnel security team discovered the insider's activity

anyOf.title: Management
anyOf.description: A member of the organization's management or the insider's management chain discovered the insider's activities

anyOf.title: Internal Investigators
anyOf.description: Investigators internal to the victim organization

anyOf.title: Researcher
anyOf.description: Researcher external to the organization

anyOf.title: Audit
anyOf.description: The insider's activity was spotted during an internal or third-party auditing process

anyOf.title: Technical Means
anyOf.description: The insider's activity was detected via analysis or anomalies in technical systems and software

anyOf.title: Non-Technical Means
anyOf.description: The insider's activity was detected in a non-technical fashion (e.g., the insider had personal items purchased with a company credit card sent to the office by accident)

anyOf.title: Security Software
anyOf.description: The insider's activity was detected by security software (e.g., the insider tried to download a document with trade secrets and an automatic alert detected the download)

anyOf.title: System Failure
anyOf.description: The insider's activity resulted in a system going down within the organization, which led to the detection of the insider's activities

anyOf.title: Access Logs
anyOf.description: File or system access logs

anyOf.title: Audit Logs
anyOf.description: Logs generated specifically for auditing purposes

anyOf.title: Bank Records
anyOf.description: Financial transaction or account records

anyOf.title: Database Logs
anyOf.description: Logs from traditional or non-traditional database servers or services

anyOf.title: Email Logs
anyOf.description: Logs from email servers or services

anyOf.title: Financial Statements
anyOf.description: Statements or records from an individual's financial account(s)

anyOf.title: ISP Logs
anyOf.description: Logs from internet service providers (ISPs)

anyOf.title: Remote Access Logs
anyOf.description: Logs from remote access servers or clients

anyOf.title: System File Logs
anyOf.description: File logs (create, delete, modify, etc.) from workstations, servers, and other systems

anyOf.title: Video Logs
anyOf.description: Video, security cam, webcam, screen capture recordings

anyOf.title: Web Logs
anyOf.description: Logs from web servers or web proxies

json\\objects\\impact.title: Impact
json\\objects\\impact.description: This is the quantified impact of the incident on the victim organization. An incident may have one or more impacts. An impact MUST be associated with only one incident.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "impact--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

high.description: The quantity of the impact being measured. If a range, the high end of the range

low.description: If a range, the low estimate of the range

metric.description: The type of impact being quantified

estimated.description: True if the impact `high` or `low` property is an estimated number

oneOf.title: Accounts
oneOf.description: Computer, network, financial, user accounts

oneOf.title: Credit card numbers
oneOf.description: Physical or digital credit or debit card numbers

oneOf.title: Customers
oneOf.description: The number of customers effected (e.g., through stolen accounts, PII, etc.)

oneOf.title: Documents
oneOf.description: The number of physical or digital documents effected (stolen, deleted, modified, etc.)

oneOf.title: Dollars
oneOf.description: Specific financial impact of money stolen, restitution ordered, etc.

oneOf.title: Employees
oneOf.description: Number of employees effected

oneOf.title: Files
oneOf.description: Number of physical or digital files stolen, read, or compromised

oneOf.title: Hours
oneOf.description: Down time or time effected in hours

oneOf.title: Pages
oneOf.description: Number of individual pages of a document(s) or file(s)

oneOf.title: Person-hours
oneOf.description: Person-hours or work time effected. Often occurs in sabotage incidents

oneOf.title: Identities
oneOf.description: PII records, user information, etc.

oneOf.title: Items
oneOf.description: Generic items such as merchandise

oneOf.title: Systems
oneOf.description: Workstations, servers, virtual machines, etc.

oneOf.title: Records
oneOf.description: Records or rows such as database or accounting records

oneOf.title: Drugs
oneOf.description: Number of pills, vials, syringes, etc. for drugs or medicine taken or effected

oneOf.title: Trade Secrets
oneOf.description: Number of trade secrets stolen or effected

json\\objects\\incident.title: Incident
json\\objects\\incident.description: This contains a description and summary details of the incident.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "incident--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

cia_effect.description: CIA triad components that were affected

incident_subtype.description: The subtype that the incident fits. This MUST match the specified incident_type

outcome.description: Consequences suffered by the victim organization as a result of the insider's attack. This is NOT the outcome or consequences imposed on the insider

status.description: The current status of the incident

summary.description: A brief prose explanation of the incident. This summary should serve as a stand-alone explanation of the incident and should include the following information as a general rule: who, what, when, where, why, and how.

brief_summary.description: A shortened version of the summary (two-four sentences, max 500 characters) with anonymized data

comment.description: Clarifying details about the incident or any of the above properties

oneOf.title: Open
oneOf.description: A case has been opened for the incident

oneOf.title: Under Investigation
oneOf.description: The incident is being investigated

oneOf.title: Referred out
oneOf.description: Incident has been referred to another team or organization

oneOf.title: Closed
oneOf.description: All investigations and legal proceedings are closed

anyOf.title: Confidentiality
anyOf.description: The protection of information from unauthorized access or disclosure

anyOf.title: Integrity
anyOf.description: The protection of information from unauthorized modification or destruction

anyOf.title: Availability
anyOf.description: The protection of information and information systems from unauthorized disruption

anyOf.title: Bankruptcy
anyOf.description: One or more victim organizations filed for bankruptcy

anyOf.title: Data Created
anyOf.description: Newly created data that is a direct result of the insider's attack

anyOf.title: Data Deleted
anyOf.description: Data was deleted from the victim organization's systems

anyOf.title: Data Modified
anyOf.description: Data was changed or modified on the victim organization's systems

anyOf.title: Data Read
anyOf.description: Organizational data was read by the insider

anyOf.title: Data Stolen
anyOf.description: Any organizational information or assets that are stolen

anyOf.title: Monetary Damages
anyOf.description: The court ordered a sum of money to be paid by the victim organization for the purpose of replacing the monetary value of property or rights which have been lost or damaged, or to cover expenses, loss, pain and suffering relating to a victim's injury or death

anyOf.title: Monetary Losses
anyOf.description: Indirect loss of money through damage, detriment, or suffering related to the incident

anyOf.title: Money Stolen
anyOf.description: The insider directly stole money from the victim organization

anyOf.title: No net negative
anyOf.description: Though an incident occurred, there were no negative consequences to the victim organization as a result

anyOf.title: Other
anyOf.description: Other type of outcome not listed in this vocabulary

anyOf.title: Restituion Ordered
anyOf.description: The organizatiion was ordered by a court to pay restitution to additional victims of the incident

anyOf.title: Safety Impact
anyOf.description: There was an impact or potential for impact to safety as a result of the incident

anyOf.title: Used in Identity Theft
anyOf.description: Identity theft of one or more individuals resulted from the incident. E.g., The insider used stolen PII to file fraudulent tax returns

anyOf.title: Fraud
anyOf.description: Deceiving the organization for personal gain at the organization's expense

anyOf.title: Sabotage
anyOf.description: Deliberate actions to harm an organization's physical or virtual infrastructure, including noncompliance with maintenance or IT procedures, contaminating clean spaces, physically damaging facilities, or deleting code to prevent regular operations

anyOf.title: Espionage
anyOf.description: The covert or illicit practice of spying on a foreign government, organization, entity, or person to obtain confidential information for military, political, strategic, or financial advantage

anyOf.title: Violence
anyOf.description: Includes the threat of violence as well as other threatening behaviors that create an intimidating, hostile, or abusive environment

anyOf.title: Unintentional
anyOf.description: The insider unwittingly causes harm or substantially increases the probability of future serious harm to the organization through action or inaction without malicious intent

anyOf.title: Embezzlement
anyOf.description: The fraudulent appropriation of the organization's property (financial or otherwise) by someone who has been entrusted with its possession

anyOf.title: Corruption
anyOf.description: Conflict of interest, bribery, illegal gratuities, and economic extortion

anyOf.title: False Statements
anyOf.description: Knowingly and willfully making false or fraudulent statements, or concealing information

anyOf.title: Virtual
anyOf.description: Taking malicious actions through technical means to disrupt or stop an organization's normal business operations

anyOf.title: Physical
anyOf.description: Taking deliberate actions aimed at harming an organization's physical infrastructure (e.g., facilities or equipment)

anyOf.title: Intellectual Property Theft
anyOf.description: Theft or robbery of an individual's or organization's ideas, inventions, or creative expressions, including trade secrets and proprietary products, even if the concepts or items being stolen originated from the insider

anyOf.title: Government
anyOf.description: Covert intelligence-gathering activities to obtain government or military secrets for the benefit of another government to obtain political or military advantage

anyOf.title: Workplace Violence
anyOf.description: Any action or threat of physical violence, harassment, sexual harassment, intimidation, bullying, offensive jokes, or other threatening behavior by a co-worker or associate that occurs in a person's place of employment or while a person is working

anyOf.title: Self Harm
anyOf.description: An incident where an insider attempts, or indicates a desire to attempt, self harm or suicide

anyOf.title: Negligence
anyOf.description: Threat caused by carelessness. Negligent insiders are generally familiar with security and/or IT policies but choose to ignore them, creating risk for the organization

anyOf.title: Accidental
anyOf.description: An incident of this type results from an insider mistakenly causing an unintended risk to an organization

json\\objects\\insider.title: Insider
json\\objects\\insider.description: This is information about the insider involved in the incident. An incident can have multiple insiders.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "insider--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

incident_role.description: Whether the insider was the primary actor or had a different role in the incident

motive.description: The insider's motive(s) for the incident

substance_use_during_incident.description: Insider was using or abusing substance(s) at the time they took one or more actions related to the incident

psychological_issues.description: Psychological issue(s) the insider experienced during or before the incident

predispositions.description: Insider's tendency toward certain actions or qualities

concerning_behaviors.description: Insider's history of past behavior that could indicate future issues

oneOf.title: Primary
oneOf.description: Insider is the primary perpetrator of the incident

oneOf.title: Co-Conspirator
oneOf.description: Insider is a co-conspirator in the incident

oneOf.title: Looked the other way
oneOf.description: Insider looked the other way while the primary perpetrator conducted the incident

oneOf.title: Approved primary insider's actions
oneOf.description: Insider knowingly approved the primary perpetrator's actions, such as by signing off on a fraudulent invoice

oneOf.title: Benefit Foreign Entity
oneOf.description: Insider committed their attack to benefit a foreign entity, such as a foreign government or military

oneOf.title: Benefit New Employer
oneOf.description: Insider committed their attack to benefit their new employer, such as by stealing a client list when they left the victim organization

oneOf.title: Competitive Business Advantage
oneOf.description: Insider committed their attack in order to gain a business advantage for a competing company. Often, this is the insider starting their own company

oneOf.title: Curiosity
oneOf.description: Insider committed the incident out of curiosity. E.g., Insider accessed medical records of a celebrity because they were curious of that celebrity's age

oneOf.title: Financial Gain
oneOf.description: Insider committed their attack to make a profit

oneOf.title: Freedom of Information
oneOf.description: The insider held the belief that it is in the best interest of the public to share the victim organization's confidential information with the public (e.g., sharing unfavorable test results of a product or unfavorable information about an organization's internal practices)

oneOf.title: Recognition
oneOf.description: The insider wanted to be recognized (e.g., for being smart, talented, capable, powerful, etc.)

oneOf.title: Revenge
oneOf.description: The insider wanted revenge for an actual or perceived wrong

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other motive not listed in this vocabulary

oneOf.title: Outpatient Treatment
oneOf.description: Insider received treatment in which they were not hospitalized overnight, but rather visited a hospital, clinic, or associated facility for diagnosis or treatment

oneOf.title: Inpatient Treatment
oneOf.description: Insider received treatment that involved 24-hour (including overnight) supervision at a hospital or dedicated psychiatric facility

oneOf.title: Medication Noncompliance
oneOf.description: The insider stopped taking a prescribed medication or following a prescribed course of treatment for a particular medical or mental health condition which, in turn, could have impacted their mental faculties

oneOf.title: Delusions
oneOf.description: The insider experienced or acted on delusions at some point during their employment within the organization

oneOf.title: Threatened/Attempted Suicide
oneOf.description: Insider threatened or attempted to commit suicide at some point during their employment within the organization

oneOf.title: Depression/Anxiety
oneOf.description: Insider expressed issues with or was diagnosed with depression or anxiety

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Insider experienced specific psychological issues not specified in this vocabulary

oneOf.title: Social and Mental Health Issues
oneOf.description: A history of behaviors related to the insider's mental health or unacceptable social behavior

oneOf.title: A History of Rule Violations
oneOf.description: A history of violating the law or violating rules at other organizations

oneOf.title: Suspicious Associations
oneOf.description: A history of associating with criminal or otherwise objectionable persons or entities

oneOf.title: Personal Stressful Events
oneOf.description: Events in the insider's personal life that could lead to additional stress or further motivate the insider to harm their organization

oneOf.title: Possible Psychological Issues
oneOf.description: Possible or confirmed mental health condition or psychological problem (e.g., the insider shared they were feeling depressed)

oneOf.title: Diagnosed Psychological Issues
oneOf.description: Insider is diagnosed with a mental health problem (e.g., the insider put on medication for depression and antipsychotics)

oneOf.title: Gambling Problems
oneOf.description: Gambling activity that negatively affects other areas of their life (e.g., the insider frequently spends multiple hours at the casino every week)

oneOf.title: Substance Abuse
oneOf.description: A history of alcohol or drugs, either previous or ongoing (e.g., the insider showed up to work intoxicated)

oneOf.title: A History Of Financial Problems
oneOf.description: Existing financial issues, including medical bills for family members (e.g., the insider had previously filed for bankruptcy)

oneOf.title: Poor Hygiene
oneOf.description: Insider had poor general hygiene

oneOf.title: Risk Taker
oneOf.description: Insider was referred to by co-workers, supervisors, or friends as a reckless or risk-taking individual

oneOf.title: Previous Arrest/Conviction For Related Crime
oneOf.description: Involvement or conviction in a previous crime which is similar in nature to the current case (e.g., the insider executed similar fraud six years earlier. Misdemeanor conviction for the same conduct with probation sentence)

oneOf.title: Previous Arrest/Conviction for Unrelated Crime
oneOf.description: Involvement in a previous crime which is unrelated to the current case (e.g., the insider was previously arrested for assault)

oneOf.title: Previous Perpetrator of Domestic Violence
oneOf.description: Previously convicted or charged on a crime involving domestic violence (e.g., the insider was previously arrested for abusing spouse)

oneOf.title: Hacking Related Activities
oneOf.description: Involvement in activities focused on obtaining unauthorized access to or otherwise harming IT systems (e.g., the insider often discussed their hacking related activities on their website)

oneOf.title: Previous Attempts to Disclose Through Illegitimate Means
oneOf.description: Disclosing or attempting to disclose information through illegitimate means (i.e., not legally protected as a whistleblower)

oneOf.title: Pending or Previous Defendant in Civil Action
oneOf.description: The insider was previously found liable in a civil action outside of the specific incident (i.e. where a insider was sued previously, which may be a motivation for the insider's actions)

oneOf.title: Previous use of illegal substances
oneOf.description: Known use of illegal narcotics or illegal use of prescribed medications

oneOf.title: Criminal Association
oneOf.description: Insider associates with known criminals or criminal organizations

oneOf.title: Internet Underground Association
oneOf.description: Insider associates with or participates in darkweb groups or activities

oneOf.title: Medical Problems
oneOf.description: Health issues experienced by anyone involved in the event since the insider's hire date (e.g., the insider contracted lupus and was put on medication)

oneOf.title: Relationship Problems
oneOf.description: A problem in one of the insider's relationships that affects the insider, including family and romantic relationships developed after the insider's hire date (e.g., the insider was going through a divorce)

oneOf.title: Emerging Financial Problems
oneOf.description: Monetary issues experienced by or relevant to the insider (including medical bills for family members) known to have developed after the insider's hire date (e.g., the insider claimed they stole from the organization in order to pay for their child's education)

oneOf.title: Family Health Issues
oneOf.description: Someone in the insider's family, or otherwise close to the insider, has health or medical issues

oneOf.title: Misuse of Company Resources
oneOf.description: Using or abusing company resources in an unauthorized manner

oneOf.title: Technical Policy Abuse
oneOf.description: Violating policies regarding the use of the organization's IT systems

oneOf.title: Interpersonal Issues
oneOf.description: Conflicts with others in the organization or human resources (HR) issues

oneOf.title: Financial
oneOf.description: Financial conflicts of interest or significant changes to financial status

oneOf.title: Organizational Conflict
oneOf.description: Competitive conflicts of interest with the organization

oneOf.title: Suspicious Contact
oneOf.description: Suspicious communication with or travel to entities, areas, or individuals that present a conflict of interest with the organization

oneOf.title: Relocation
oneOf.description: Physical relocation

oneOf.title: Theft Of Physical Company Property
oneOf.description: Stealing their employer's physical property (e.g., the insider reported a company laptop as stolen, but had it when they were arrested)

oneOf.title: Insider Expressed Ownership Of Work
oneOf.description: Acting as if they had personal right to any work done for the organization, despite knowledge of organizational right to employee work (e.g., the insider refused to return copy of code that they wrote because they felt entitled to it)

oneOf.title: Repeated Security Violations - Non-Technical
oneOf.description: Violating organizational security policies not related to IT systems (e.g., the insider broke into the school on multiple occasions and was also caught cheating)

oneOf.title: Other Unauthorized Software Acquisition
oneOf.description: Acquiring any sort of unauthorized software on an organizational system (e.g., the insider downloaded a password recovery tool from a website)

oneOf.title: Repeated Security Violations - Technical
oneOf.description: Multiple instances of security violations related to organizational IT systems (e.g., the insider repeatedly let co-workers use their workstation)

oneOf.title: Unauthorized Download - Remotely
oneOf.description: Unapproved download from offsite (e.g., the insider logged into their company account from home on their personal laptop and downloaded torrents)

oneOf.title: Unauthorized Download - On Site
oneOf.description: Unapproved download from within the organization (e.g., the insider used their company-issued workstation to download torrents)

oneOf.title: IP Policy Violation
oneOf.description: Violating any of the policies put in place by the company regarding their IP (i.e. trade secrets, patents, copyright, etc.)

oneOf.title: Violation of Need to Know
oneOf.description: Accessing organizational information which is not needed for their work, as defined by organizational policy

oneOf.title: Employee Extortion, Threats, or Legal Demands
oneOf.description: Extortion, threats (physical, technical, legal, etc.) or legal demands against the organization (e.g., the insider threatened to sue company unless they agreed to the terms of their demands)

oneOf.title: Conflict With Supervisor
oneOf.description: Personal or work-related disputes with their supervisor (e.g., the insider was unhappy with their new boss because the boss modified the organization's bonus system)

oneOf.title: Conflict With Coworker(s)
oneOf.description: Personal or work-related disputes with a coworker (e.g., the insider yelled at a coworker for repeatedly parking in their spot)

oneOf.title: Work Attendance Problems
oneOf.description: Being late for work or having unexcused/unplanned absences from work, generally multiple times (e.g., the insider reports late to work 7 times during the month of April)

oneOf.title: Human Resource Policy Violations or Complaints
oneOf.description: Violating the organization's human resource policy or making a formal complaint about something/someone within the organization (e.g., the insider made several complaints to management about their co-worker's noise level)

oneOf.title: Disgruntled Employee
oneOf.description: One who is upset with the organization and desires to get a measure of revenge against the organization (e.g., the insider grew disgruntled because of losing their 'star' status at the organization as it grew larger)

oneOf.title: Bragging
oneOf.description: The insider boasts about a concerning behavior to co-workers or online (e.g., the insider boasted about being able to shut down the organization's system anytime they wanted)

oneOf.title: Concurrent Crimes
oneOf.description: The insider commits a second illegal action while committing the unrelated illegal insider incident (e.g., the insider was indicted for domestic abuse while committing the insider incident)

oneOf.title: Formal Complaint
oneOf.description: Organization receives complaints about the insider from a coworker which were officially documented

oneOf.title: Informal Complaint
oneOf.description: Organization receives complaints about the insider from a coworker which were not officially documented

oneOf.title: Insubordination
oneOf.description: Defiance or refusal to follow commands or instructions

oneOf.title: Physical Abuse/Harassment
oneOf.description: Engaging in any type of physical abuse and/or harassment against another employee

oneOf.title: Sexual Harassment
oneOf.description: Engaging in any type of sexual harassment against another employee

oneOf.title: Unexplained Wealth
oneOf.description: A sudden increase in the amount of money the insider appears to have (e.g., the insider purchased $400,000 in personal items even though their annual salary was $50,000)

oneOf.title: Employee Forms New Competing Business
oneOf.description: Maintains a financial stake in another business or scheme that conflicts with their present employer (e.g., the insider invests in stocks of the victim organization's competitor)

oneOf.title: Financial Conflict of Interest
oneOf.description: Starting a business in the same area as their previous employer (e.g., the insider left one law firm to start their own law firm)

oneOf.title: Planning/Contact with Competing Organization
oneOf.description: Conspiring with a competitor of the current employer in any way (e.g., the insider e-mailed a competing organization detailing plans to steal trade secrets)

oneOf.title: Employee Went To Work For A Competing Organization
oneOf.description: Leaving their current employer and joining a competing organization. E.g., Insider accepted a position at a competing technical firm before resigning from their current position.

oneOf.title: Employee Sought Other Employment
oneOf.description: Seeking another job while still employed with their current employer (e.g., the insider sent their resume to another organization)

oneOf.title: Group Resignation
oneOf.description: Two or more employees leave the organization at approximately the same time for similar reasons (e.g., all five insiders resigned simultaneously, then went to work for a competitor)

oneOf.title: Insider Creates Legal Entity for Illegitimate Purpose
oneOf.description: Creates a legal entity in order to move forward with scheme or to hide assets as a result of the scheme (e.g., the insider creates a shell company to protect assets)

oneOf.title: Falsified Background Information
oneOf.description: Lies about or otherwise manipulates information about their background: personal or financial history, contacts, groups, etc.

oneOf.title: Suspicious Foreign Contact
oneOf.description: Tie(s) to foreign nation(s) such as company or independent travel, family members, telephone records, etc. (e.g., the insider consistently calls former co-worker who now works in a non-allied country)

oneOf.title: Suspicious Foreign Travel
oneOf.description: Traveling to foreign nations that, if the travel was known, should raise concerns with the organization

oneOf.title: Foreign Travel - Work Related
oneOf.description: Travel undertaken by the insider as required for their job (e.g., the insider's job required frequent travel to non-allied countries)

oneOf.title: Planning/Contact with Conspirator
oneOf.description: Conspiring with a conspirator in order to begin or further their particular scheme (e.g., the insider calls their partner-in-crime in order to establish attack details)

oneOf.title: Geographic Relocation
oneOf.description: Permanent move to a new physical location

json\\objects\\job.title: Job
json\\objects\\job.description: This contains details of the employment relationship between an individual and an organization. A job may be connected to only one organization and may be connected to only one insider or accomplice.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "job--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

job_function.description: Functional category of the individual's job. job_function and occupation vocabularies are based in large part on the 2018 Standard Occupational Classification system published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics

occupation.description: The subcategory of the individual's job. When present, `job_function` should also be present. The chosen constant for occupation MUST match the constant for job_function

title.description: The individual's job title. If title is specified, `occupation` should be as well

position_technical.description: The individual had access to technical areas of the organization as part of their job role (e.g., IT admin, network engineer, help desk associate)

access_authorization.description: The level of access control given by this job role

employment_type.description: The individual's employment arrangement at the time of the incident

hire_date.description: Date the individual was hired into this position

departure_date.description: Date the individual departed from this position

tenure.description: The amount of time the individual spent in this particular job role

comment.description: Clarifying comments or details about the job or the individual's employment with the organization

oneOf.title: Textile, Apparel, and Furnishings Workers
oneOf.description: Laundry and Dry-Cleaning Workers, Shoe and Leather Workers, Sewers, Tailors, Dressmakers, Textile Operators and Machine Setters, Patternmakers, Upholsterers, etc.

oneOf.title: Woodworkers
oneOf.description: Cabinetmakers and Bench Carpenters, Furniture Finishers, Model Makers, Patternmakers, Machine Setters and Operators, etc.

oneOf.title: Plant and System Operators
oneOf.description: Nuclear Power Reactor Operators, Power Distributors and Dispatchers, Plant Operators, Stationary Engineers and Boiler Operators, Petroleum Pump System Operators, Refinery Operators, Gaugers, etc.

oneOf.title: Other Production Occupations
oneOf.description: Chemical Equipment Operators, Appliance Technicians, Inspectors, Testers, Sorters, Jewelers, Metal Workers, Laboratory Technicians, Machine Operators, Painting Workers, Production Workers, etc.

oneOf.title: Supervisors of Transportation and Material Moving Workers
oneOf.description: Aircraft Cargo Handling Supervisors, First-Line Supervisors of Helpers, Laborers, Material Movers, Vehicle Operators, Passenger Attendants, Transportation Workers, etc.

oneOf.title: Air Transportation Workers
oneOf.description: Pilots, Copilots, Flight Engineers, Air Traffic Controllers, Airfield Operations Specialists, Flight Attendants, etc.

oneOf.title: Motor Vehicle Operators
oneOf.description: Drivers and other motor vehicle operators.

oneOf.title: Rail Transportation Workers
oneOf.description: Engineers, Operators, Hostlers, Locomotive Firers, Conductors, Yardmasters, etc.

oneOf.title: Water Transportation Workers
oneOf.description: Sailors and Marine Oilers, Captains, Mates, and Pilots of Water Vessels, Motorboat Operators, Ship Engineers, etc.

oneOf.title: Other Transportation Workers
oneOf.description: Bridge and Lock Tenders, Parking Attendants, Service Attendants, Traffic Technicians, Transportation Inspectors, Passenger Attendants, etc.

oneOf.title: Material Moving Workers
oneOf.description: Packers, Stockers, Refuse Collectors, Loaders, Crane Operators, Truck and Tractor Operators, Laborers, etc.

oneOf.title: Military Officer Special and Tactical Operations Leaders
oneOf.description: Crew Officers, Infantry Officers, Special Forces Officers, All Other Military Officer Special and Tactical Operations Leaders

oneOf.title: First-Line Enlisted Military Supervisors
oneOf.description: Supervisors of Crew Members, Supervisors of Tactical Operations Specialists, In-Flight Refueling Manager, Superintendent, Intelligence Chief, etc.

oneOf.title: Military Enlisted Tactical Operations, Specialists, and Crew Members
oneOf.description: Crew Members, Specialists, Infantry, Special Forces, etc.

oneOf.title: Student
oneOf.description: Student

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other occupation not listed

oneOf.title: Access Revoked
oneOf.description: Access was revoked after departing or as a disciplinary action

oneOf.title: Administrator/Root
oneOf.description: Authorized full administrative access

oneOf.title: Authorized Account & Data
oneOf.description: Authorized account and access to targeted data

oneOf.title: Authorized Account Only
oneOf.description: Authorized account but not authorized access to targeted data

oneOf.title: Authorized Privileged User
oneOf.description: Authorized privileged access

oneOf.title: Authorized Unprivileged User
oneOf.description: Authorized unprivileged access

oneOf.title: Former Employee, Access not Deactivated
oneOf.description: Access was not properly revoked after departure from the organization

oneOf.title: Never Given Access
oneOf.description: Never given system access

oneOf.title: Unauthorized
oneOf.description: Unauthorized access

oneOf.title: Contractor
oneOf.description: Individual not directly employed by the organization whose job responsibilities they are filling (self-employed or employed by a different, contracting organization)

oneOf.title: Full-time
oneOf.description: Individual who is directly employed by the organization and works at least 35 hours per week or is classified by the organization as a full-time employee

oneOf.title: Part-time
oneOf.description: Individual who is directly employed by the organization and works less than 35 hours per week or is classified by the organization as a part-time employee

oneOf.title: Intern/Trainee/Aprentice
oneOf.description: An advanced student or graduate gaining supervised practical experience in a particular field or job role, sometimes without pay

oneOf.title: Temporary Employee
oneOf.description: Individual hired for a brief period of time or until a certain project is completed

oneOf.title: Volunteer
oneOf.description: Individual not employed by the organization, but who donates their time to working on projects without receiving pay or benefits

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other employment type not listed in this vocabulary

json\\objects\\legal-response.title: Legal Response
json\\objects\\legal-response.description: This is information about the legal response to the incident, particularly the dates of important milestones in the legal process. A response may have one legal response. A legal response may have multiple charges and may have multiple sentences.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "legal-response--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

law_enforcement_contacted.description: Organization contacts law enforcement to aid in the investigation of the incident (e.g., police are called to respond to the insider's violent behavior in the workplace)

insider_arrested.description: Insider is taken into custody (e.g., police arrest insider in their home)

insider_charged.description: Insider is formally charged. Charges must relate to the incident. This category also covers a waiver of indictment and subsequent filing of information (e.g., the insider was indicted on computer fraud charges)

insider_pleads.description: Insider puts forth a plea to the court, including guilty, not guilty, or nolo contendere (no contest) (e.g., the insider pleads guilty to computer intrusion)

insider_judgment.description: Insider is found guilty, not guilty, or liable or not liable in a court of law (e.g., the insider is found guilty in a jury trial)

insider_sentenced.description: Insider is given a legally mandated punishment (e.g., the insider is sentenced to five months in jail, then supervised release, community service, and restitution)

insider_charges_dropped.description: The plaintiff drops their case against the insider (e.g., the organization in a civil suit decides to drop the suit)

insider_charges_dismissed.description: The plaintiff dismiss their case against the insider (e.g., upon discovery of further evidence, the judge decided to drop the charges against the insider)

insider_settled.description: The case against the insider is settled outside of the courtroom (e.g., the victim organization reached an agreement with the insider to not file formal charges in return for financial compensation)

comment.description: Comments clarifying the details or dates of the legal response

json\\objects\\note.title: Note
json\\objects\\note.description: This is a freeform text space for holding notes related to the case management of the incident as it is being investigated, such as a checklist to follow up on or comments related to the current status. Notes are not intended to be used to hold details about the incident itself. An incident may have one or more notes.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "note--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

author.description: Individual, group, or organization that authored the note

date.description: Date and time the note was authored or most recently modified

comment.description: Notes, comments, and details as needed
