json\\objects\\organization.title: Organization
json\\objects\\organization.description: This is the organization(s) involved in the incident. At least one organization, the victim organization, should be included as part of an incident bundle. There may be other organizations involved, such as a competitor organization that benefitted from stolen data or a pass-through organization that received kickbacks. The victim organization(s) include all organizations negatively impacted by the incident, not just the organization(s) that employed the insider.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "organization--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

name.description: The name of the organization (e.g., "Company XYZ, Inc.")

city.description: The city where the organization is located. Use the address of the headquarters if the whole organization was affected. Use the address of the local branch if only that local branch was affected.

state.description: The state where the organization is located. Use the address of the headquarters if the whole organization was affected. Use the address of the local branch if only that local branch was affected.

country.description: The country where the organization is located. Use the address of the headquarters if the whole organization was affected. Use the address of the local branch if only that local branch was affected. Public implementations should use the standard codes provided by ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

postal_code.description: The postal code of the organization. Use the address of the headquarters if the whole organization was affected. Use the address of the local branch if only that local branch was affected.

small_business.description: TRUE if the organization is a privately owned business with 500 or fewer employees

industry_sector.description: Top-level category for the economic sector the organization belongs to. Note, sectors are derived from the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) version 2022 published by the United States Office of Management and Budget.

industry_subsector.description: Second-level category for the economic sector the organization belongs to. This value MUST map back to industry_sector (e.g., if sector is "9," subsector must be "9.x").

parent_company.description: Name of the organization's parent company, if applicable

incident_role.description: The organization's role in the incident

oneOf.title: Agriculture and Mining
oneOf.description: Growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, or extraction of naturally occurring minerals.

oneOf.title: Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
oneOf.description: Establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, liquid minerals, and gases, to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating, and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.

oneOf.title: Utilities
oneOf.description: Provisioning of services for the public (e.g., energy, water, and waste collection).

oneOf.title: Construction
oneOf.description: Construction and engineering of buildings and associated support services or trades.

oneOf.title: Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Mechanical, Chemical, Physical changes to material.

oneOf.title: Wholesale Trade
oneOf.description: The exchange of goods and services.

oneOf.title: Retail Trade
oneOf.description: The exchange of goods and services.

oneOf.title: Transportation and Warehousing
oneOf.description: Services directly or indirectly involved in the movement of people.

oneOf.title: Information
oneOf.description: Hardware or software systems related to the processing, communications, and accessing of information.

oneOf.title: Finance and Insurance
oneOf.description: Financial services, payment processors, and insurance.

oneOf.title: Real Estate and Rental/Leasing
oneOf.description: Property sales and renting/leasing of assets.

oneOf.title: Professional Services, Scientific and Technical Services
oneOf.description: Services provided by trained professionals in specialized fields.

oneOf.title: Management of Companies and Enterprises
oneOf.description: Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.

oneOf.title: Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
oneOf.description: Establishments performing routine support activities for the day-to-day operations of other organizations.

oneOf.title: Educational Services
oneOf.description: Instruction and training of individuals.

oneOf.title: Healthcare and Social Assistance
oneOf.description: Medical care and social advocacy/assistance.

oneOf.title: Arts, Entertainment, Recreation
oneOf.description: Industries that meet the entertainment needs of patrons.

oneOf.title: Accommodation and Food Services
oneOf.description: Establishments providing customers with lodging and/or preparing meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption.

oneOf.title: Public Administration
oneOf.description: Federal/State/Local administration and the oversight of public programs.

oneOf.title: Other Services
oneOf.description: Other services defined in NAICS.

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other sector not listed in this vocabulary.

oneOf.title: Crop Production
oneOf.description: Industries in the Crop Production subsector grow crops mainly for food and fiber. The subsector comprises establishments, such as farms, orchards, groves, greenhouses, and nurseries, primarily engaged in growing crops, plants, vines, or trees and their seeds.

oneOf.title: Animal Production and Aquaculture
oneOf.description: Industries in the Animal Production and Aquaculture subsector raise or fatten animals for the sale of animals or animal products and/or raise aquatic plants and animals in controlled or selected aquatic environments for the sale of aquatic plants, animals, or their products. The subsector includes establishments, such as ranches, farms, and feedlots, primarily engaged in keeping, grazing, breeding, or feeding animals.

oneOf.title: Forestry and Logging
oneOf.description: Industries in the Forestry and Logging subsector grow and harvest timber on a long production cycle (i.e., of 10 years or more).

oneOf.title: Fishing, Hunting and Trapping
oneOf.description: Industries in the Fishing, Hunting and Trapping subsector harvest fish and other wild animals from their natural habitats and are dependent upon a continued supply of the natural resource.

oneOf.title: Support Activities for Agriculture and Forestry
oneOf.description: Industries in the Support Activities for Agriculture and Forestry subsector provide support services that are an essential part of agricultural and forestry production. These support activities may be performed by the agriculture or forestry producing establishment or conducted independently as an alternative source of inputs required for the production process for a given crop, animal, or forestry industry.

oneOf.title: Oil and Gas Extraction
oneOf.description: Industries in the Oil and Gas Extraction subsector operate and/or develop oil and gas field properties. Such activities may include exploration for crude petroleum and natural gas; drilling, completing, and equipping wells; operating separators, emulsion breakers, desilting equipment, and field gathering lines for crude petroleum and natural gas; and all other activities in the preparation of oil and gas up to the point of shipment from the producing property.

oneOf.title: Mining (except Oil and Gas)
oneOf.description: Industries in the Mining (except Oil and Gas) subsector primarily engage in mining, mine site development, and beneficiating (i.e., preparing) metallic minerals and nonmetallic minerals, including coal.

oneOf.title: Support Activities for Mining
oneOf.description: Industries in the Support Activities for Mining subsector group establishments primarily providing support services, on a contract or fee basis (except geophysical surveying and mapping, mine site preparation, construction, and transportation activities), required for the mining and quarrying of minerals and for the extraction of oil and gas. Establishments performing exploration for minerals, on a contract or fee basis, are included in this subsector. Exploration services include traditional prospecting methods, such as taking core samples and making geological observations at prospective sites.

oneOf.title: Utilities
oneOf.description: Industries in the Utilities subsector provide electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal through a permanent infrastructure of lines, mains, and meters.

oneOf.title: Construction of Buildings
oneOf.description: Industries primarily engaged in the construction of buildings. These establishments are responsible for the complete construction (i.e., new work, additions, alterations, maintenance, and repairs) of residential, farm, industrial, commercial, and other buildings.

oneOf.title: Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction
oneOf.description: This subsector comprises establishments whose primary activity is the construction of entire engineering projects (e.g., highways and dams) and specialty trade contractors whose primary activity is the production of a specific component for such projects.

oneOf.title: Specialty Trade Contractors
oneOf.description: This subsector comprises establishments whose primary activity is performing specific activities involved in building construction or other activities that are similar for all types of construction, but that are not responsible for the entire project.

oneOf.title: Food Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Industries primarily engaged in transforming livestock and agricultural products into products for intermediate or final consumption. The industry groups are distinguished by the raw materials (generally of animal or vegetable origin) processed into food products.

oneOf.title: Beverage and Tobacco Product Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Industries in the Beverage and Tobacco Product Manufacturing subsector manufacture beverages and tobacco products. The transformation of agricultural materials into beverages and tobacco products is an integrated operation.

oneOf.title: Textile Mills
oneOf.description: Industries in the Textile Mills subsector group establishments that transform a basic fiber (natural or synthetic) into a product, such as yarn or fabric that is further manufactured into usable items, such as apparel, sheets, towels, and textile bags for individual or industrial consumption.

oneOf.title: Textile Product Mills
oneOf.description: Industries in the Textile Product Mills subsector group establishments that make textile products (except apparel). With a few exceptions, processes used by these establishments are generally cut and sew (i.e., purchasing fabric and cutting and sewing to make nonapparel textile products, such as sheets and towels).

oneOf.title: Apparel Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Industries in the Apparel Manufacturing subsector group establishments with two distinct manufacturing processes: (1) cut and sew (i.e., purchasing fabric and cutting and sewing to make a garment) and (2) the manufacture of garments in establishments that first knit fabric and then cut and sew the fabric into a garment.

oneOf.title: Leather and Allied Product Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Establishments in the Leather and Allied Product Manufacturing subsector transform hides into leather by tanning or curing and fabricating the leather into products for final consumption.

oneOf.title: Wood Product Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Industries in the Wood Product Manufacturing subsector manufacture wood products, such as lumber, plywood, veneers, wood containers, wood flooring, wood trusses, manufactured homes (mobile homes), and prefabricated wood buildings and components.

oneOf.title: Paper Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Industries in the Paper Manufacturing subsector make pulp, paper, or converted paper products. The manufacturing of these products is grouped together because they constitute a series of vertically connected processes.

oneOf.title: Printing and Related Support Activities
oneOf.description: Industries in the Printing and Related Support Activities subsector print products, such as newspapers, books, labels, business cards, stationery, business forms, and other materials, and perform support activities, such as data imaging, platemaking services, and bookbinding.

oneOf.title: Petroleum and Coal Products Manufacturing
oneOf.description: The Petroleum and Coal Products Manufacturing subsector is based on the transformation of crude petroleum and coal into usable products. The dominant process is petroleum refining that involves the separation of crude petroleum into component products through such techniques as cracking and distillation.

oneOf.title: Chemical Manufacturing
oneOf.description: The Chemical Manufacturing subsector is based on the transformation of organic and inorganic raw materials by a chemical process and the formulation of products. This subsector distinguishes the production of basic chemicals that comprise the first industry group from the production of intermediate and end products produced by further processing of basic chemicals.

oneOf.title: Plastics and Rubber Products Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Industries in the Plastics and Rubber Products Manufacturing subsector make goods by processing plastics materials and raw rubber. The core technology employed by establishments in this subsector is that of plastics or rubber product production.

oneOf.title: Nonmetallic Mineral Product Manufacturing
oneOf.description: The Nonmetallic Mineral Product Manufacturing subsector is based on the transformation of mined or quarried nonmetallic minerals, such as sand, gravel, stone, clay, and refractory materials, into products for intermediate or final consumption.

oneOf.title: Primary Metal Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Industries in the Primary Metal Manufacturing subsector smelt and/or refine ferrous and nonferrous metals from ore, pig, or scrap, using electrometallurgical and other process metallurgical techniques.

oneOf.title: Fabricated Metal Product Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Industries in the Fabricated Metal Product Manufacturing subsector are involved in the transformation of metals into intermediate or final products, other than machinery and equipment.

oneOf.title: Machinery Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Industries in the Machinery Manufacturing subsector create machines that apply mechanical force to perform work across a variety of applications.

oneOf.title: Computer and Electronic Product Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Industries in the Computer and Electronic Product Manufacturing subsector manufacture computers, computer peripherals, communications equipment, and similar electronic products.

oneOf.title: Electrical Equipment, Appliance, and Component Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Industries in this subsector manufacture products that generate, distribute, and use electrical power.

oneOf.title: Transportation Equipment Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Industries in the Transportation Equipment Manufacturing subsector produce equipment for transporting people and goods.

oneOf.title: Furniture and Related Product Manufacturing
oneOf.description: Industries in the Furniture and Related Product Manufacturing subsector make furniture and related articles, such as mattresses, window blinds, cabinets, and fixtures.

oneOf.title: Miscellaneous Manufacturing
oneOf.description: This subsector includes industries that make products not classified in other subsectors, including products made from materials like plastics and rubber.

oneOf.title: Merchant Wholesalers, Durable Goods
oneOf.description: Industries in this subsector sell capital or durable goods to other businesses.

oneOf.title: Merchant Wholesalers, Nondurable Goods
oneOf.description: Industries in the Merchant Wholesalers, Nondurable Goods subsector sell nondurable goods to other businesses.

oneOf.title: Wholesale Trade Agents and Brokers
oneOf.description: This subsector includes establishments that arrange for the purchase or sale of goods owned by others, typically on a commission basis.

oneOf.title: Motor Vehicle and Parts Dealers
oneOf.description: Industries in this subsector retail motor vehicles and parts, dealing with new and used vehicles, and providing maintenance services.

oneOf.title: Building Material and Garden Equipment and Supplies Dealers
oneOf.description: Industries in this subsector retail new building material and garden equipment and supplies from fixed point-of-sale locations.

oneOf.title: Food and Beverage Stores
oneOf.description: Establishments in this subsector usually retail food and beverages merchandised in fixed point-of-sale locations.

oneOf.title: Furniture, Home Furnishings, Electronics, and Appliance Stores
oneOf.description: Industries in this subsector retail new furniture, home furnishings, electronics, and appliances.

oneOf.title: General Merchandise Stores
oneOf.description: This subsector includes establishments primarily engaged in retailing a general line of merchandise, including department stores, warehouse clubs, and supercenters.

oneOf.title: Health and Personal Care Stores
oneOf.description: Industries in this subsector are engaged in retailing health and personal care merchandise from fixed point-of-sale locations.

oneOf.title: Gasoline Stations
oneOf.description: Establishments in this subsector are primarily engaged in retailing automotive fuels (e.g., gasoline, diesel) in combination with convenience store items.

oneOf.title: Clothing and Clothing Accessories Stores
oneOf.description: This subsector includes establishments engaged in retailing new clothing and clothing accessories, such as footwear, hats, gloves, and belts.

oneOf.title: Sporting Goods, Hobby, Musical Instrument, and Book Stores
oneOf.description: Establishments in this subsector retail new sporting goods, hobby items, musical instruments, books, and games.

oneOf.title: Air Transportation
oneOf.description: Industries in this subsector provide air transportation of passengers and/or goods using aircraft, such as airplanes and helicopters.

oneOf.title: Rail Transportation
oneOf.description: Industries in the Rail Transportation subsector provide passenger and/or freight transportation over tracks.

oneOf.title: Water Transportation
oneOf.description: Industries in this subsector provide water transportation of passengers and cargo using ships, boats, and barges.

oneOf.title: Truck Transportation
oneOf.description: Industries in this subsector provide over-the-road transportation of cargo using motor vehicles, such as trucks and tractor trailers.

oneOf.title: Transit and Ground Passenger Transportation
oneOf.description: This subsector includes industries providing passenger transportation, such as buses and taxis.

oneOf.title: Pipeline Transportation
oneOf.description: Industries in this subsector transport goods using pipelines, including transporting products such as natural gas and crude oil.

oneOf.title: Scenic and Sightseeing Transportation
oneOf.description: This industry comprises establishments primarily engaged in providing scenic and sightseeing transportation on land, such as sightseeing buses and trolleys, steam train excursions, and horse-drawn sightseeing rides. The services provided are usually local and involve same-day return to the place of origin.

oneOf.title: Support Activities for Transportation
oneOf.description: Industries in the Support Activities for Transportation subsector provide services which support transportation. These services may be provided to transportation carrier establishments or to the general public. This subsector includes a wide array of establishments, including air traffic control services, marine cargo handling, and motor vehicle towing.

oneOf.title: Postal Service
oneOf.description: The Postal Service subsector includes the activities of the National Post Office and its subcontractors operating under a universal service obligation to provide mail services, and using the infrastructure required to fulfill that obligation. These services include delivering letters and small parcels. These articles can be described as those that can be handled by one person without using special equipment.

oneOf.title: Couriers and Messengers
oneOf.description: Industries in the Couriers and Messengers subsector provide intercity, local, and/or international delivery of parcels and documents (including express delivery services) without operating under a universal service obligation. These articles may originate in the U.S. but be delivered to another country and can be described as those that may be handled by one person without using special equipment.

oneOf.title: Warehousing and Storage
oneOf.description: Industries in the Warehousing and Storage subsector are primarily engaged in operating warehousing and storage facilities for general merchandise, refrigerated goods, and other warehouse products. These establishments provide facilities to store goods. They do not sell the goods they handle. These establishments take responsibility for storing the goods and keeping them secure.

oneOf.title: Motion Picture and Sound Recording Industries
oneOf.description: This industry group comprises establishments primarily engaged in producing and distributing musical recordings, publishing music, or providing sound recording and related services.

oneOf.title: Publishing Industries
oneOf.description: Industries in the Publishing Industries subsector group establishments engaged in publishing newspapers, magazines, other periodicals, books, directories, and software. In general, establishments known as publishers issue copies of works for which they usually possess copyright.

oneOf.title: Broadcasting and Content Providers
oneOf.description: Industries in the Broadcasting and Content Providers subsector include establishments that create content or acquire the right to distribute content and subsequently broadcast or distribute that content. The industry groups are based on differences in the methods of communication and the nature of services provided.

oneOf.title: Telecommunications
oneOf.description: Industries in this subsector provide telecommunications services, such as transmitting voice, data, text, sound, and video. This includes establishments providing telephone, data transmission, cellular, cable, and other subscription programming services.

oneOf.title: Computing Infrastructure Providers, Data Processing, Web Hosting, and Related Services
oneOf.description: The Computing Infrastructure Providers, Data Processing, Web Hosting, and Related Services subsector groups establishments that provide computing infrastructure, data processing services, Web hosting services (except software publishing), and related services, including streaming support services (except streaming distribution services).

oneOf.title: Web Search Portals, Libraries, Archives, and Other Information Services
oneOf.description: Industries in the Web Search Portals, Libraries, Archives, and Other Information Services subsector group establishments supplying information, storing and providing access to information, searching and retrieving information, and operating websites that use search engines to allow for searching information on the Internet. The main components of the subsector are libraries, archives, and web search portals.

oneOf.title: Monetary Authorities-Central Bank
oneOf.description: The Monetary Authorities-Central Bank subsector groups establishments that engage in performing central banking functions, such as issuing currency, managing the Nation's money supply and international reserves, holding deposits that represent the reserves of other banks and other central banks, and acting as a fiscal agent for the central government.

oneOf.title: Credit Intermediation and Related Activities
oneOf.description: Industries in the Credit Intermediation and Related Activities subsector group establishments that (1) lend funds raised from depositors; (2) lend funds raised from credit market borrowing; or (3) facilitate the lending of funds or issuance of credit by engaging in such activities as mortgage and loan brokerage, clearinghouse and reserve services, and check cashing services.

oneOf.title: Securities, Commodity Contracts, and Other Financial Investments and Related Activities
oneOf.description: Industries in the Securities, Commodity Contracts, and Other Financial Investments and Related Activities subsector group establishments that are primarily engaged in one of the following: (1) underwriting securities issues and/or making markets for securities and commodities; (2) acting as agents (i.e., brokers) between buyers and sellers of securities and commodities; (3) providing securities and commodity exchange services; and (4) providing other services, such as managing portfolios of assets; providing investment advice; and trust, fiduciary, and custody services.

oneOf.title: Insurance Carriers and Related Activities
oneOf.description: Industries in the Insurance Carriers and Related Activities subsector group establishments that are primarily engaged in one of the following: (1) underwriting (assuming the risk, assigning premiums, and so forth) annuities and insurance policies or (2) facilitating such underwriting by selling insurance policies and by providing other insurance and employee benefit related services.

oneOf.title: Funds, Trusts, and Other Financial Vehicles
oneOf.description: Industries in the Funds, Trusts, and Other Financial Vehicles subsector group legal entities (i.e., funds, plans, and/or programs) organized to pool securities or other assets on behalf of shareholders or beneficiaries of employee benefit or other trust funds. The portfolios are customized to achieve specific investment characteristics, such as diversification, risk, rate of return, and price volatility.

oneOf.title: Real Estate
oneOf.description: Industries in the Real Estate subsector lease real estate property, manage real estate property, sell, buy, or rent real estate property, provide real estate related services, or act as lessors of residential buildings and dwellings, including equity real estate investment trusts (REITs).

oneOf.title: Rental and Leasing Services
oneOf.description: Industries in the Rental and Leasing Services subsector lease or rent a vast array of tangible goods, such as automobiles, consumer goods, and professional equipment. Establishments in this subsector generally provide a wide array of products and services to a variety of customers.

oneOf.title: Lessors of Nonfinancial Intangible Assets (except Copyrighted Works)
oneOf.description: Industries in the Lessors of Nonfinancial Intangible Assets (except Copyrighted Works) subsector include establishments primarily engaged in assigning rights to assets, such as patents, trademarks, brand names, and/or franchise agreements, for which a royalty payment or licensing fee is paid to the asset holder.

oneOf.title: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
oneOf.description: The Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services sector comprises establishments that specialize in performing professional, scientific, and technical activities for others. These activities require a high degree of expertise and training. The establishments in this sector specialize according to expertise and provide these services to clients in a variety of industries and, in some cases, to households.

oneOf.title: Management of Companies and Enterprises
oneOf.description: The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions, or establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise.

oneOf.title: Administrative and Support Services
oneOf.description: The Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services sector comprises establishments performing routine support activities for the day-to-day operations of other organizations. These activities are often undertaken in-house by establishments in many sectors of the economy. The establishments in this sector specialize in one or more of these support activities and provide these services to clients in a variety of industries and, in some cases, to households.

oneOf.title: Waste Management and Remediation Services
oneOf.description: The Waste Management and Remediation Services subsector includes establishments engaged in the collection, treatment, and disposal of waste materials. This also includes local hauling of waste materials and operating materials recovery facilities.

oneOf.title: Educational Services
oneOf.description: The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training are provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.

oneOf.title: Ambulatory Health Care Services
oneOf.description: Industries in the Ambulatory Health Care Services subsector provide health care services directly or indirectly to ambulatory patients and do not usually provide inpatient services. Health practitioners provide outpatient services with the facilities and equipment not usually being the most significant part of the production process.

oneOf.title: Hospitals
oneOf.description: This industry comprises establishments known and licensed as general medical and surgical hospitals primarily engaged in providing diagnostic and medical treatment (both surgical and nonsurgical) to inpatients with any of a wide variety of medical conditions.

oneOf.title: Nursing and Residential Care Facilities
oneOf.description: Industries in the Nursing and Residential Care Facilities subsector provide residential care combined with either nursing, supervisory, or other types of care as required by the residents.

oneOf.title: Social Assistance
oneOf.description: This industry comprises establishments primarily engaged in providing a wide variety of social assistance services directly to their clients. These services do not include residential or accommodation services, except on a short-term basis.

oneOf.title: Performing Arts, Spectator Sports, and Related Industries
oneOf.description: Industries in the Performing Arts, Spectator Sports, and Related Industries subsector group establishments that produce or organize and promote live presentations involving the performances of actors and actresses, singers, dancers, musical groups and artists, athletes, and other entertainers, including independent (i.e., freelance) entertainers and the establishments that manage their careers.

oneOf.title: Museums, Historical Sites, and Similar Institutions
oneOf.description: Industries in the Museums, Historical Sites, and Similar Institutions subsector engage in the preservation and exhibition of objects, sites, and natural wonders of historical, cultural, and/or educational value.

oneOf.title: Amusement, Gambling, and Recreation Industries
oneOf.description: Industries in the Amusement, Gambling, and Recreation Industries subsector operate facilities where patrons can primarily engage in sports, recreation, amusement, or gambling activities and/or provide other amusement and recreation services, such as supplying and servicing amusement devices in places of business operated by others; operating sports teams, clubs, or leagues engaged in playing games for recreational purposes; and guiding tours without using transportation equipment.

oneOf.title: Accommodation
oneOf.description: Industries in the Accommodation subsector provide lodging or short-term accommodations for travelers, vacationers, and others. There is a wide range of establishments in these industries. Some provide lodging only; others provide meals, laundry services, and recreational facilities, as well as lodging.

oneOf.title: Food Services and Drinking Places
oneOf.description: Industries in the Food Services and Drinking Places subsector prepare meals, snacks, and beverages to customer order for immediate on-premises and off-premises consumption. There is a wide range of establishments in these industries. Some provide food and drink only; others provide various types of entertainment as well.

oneOf.title: Repair and Maintenance
oneOf.description: Industries in the Repair and Maintenance subsector restore machinery, equipment, and other products to working order. These establishments also typically provide general or routine maintenance (i.e., servicing) on such products to ensure they work efficiently and to prevent breakdown and unnecessary repairs.

oneOf.title: Personal and Laundry Services
oneOf.description: Industries in the Personal and Laundry Services subsector provide personal and laundry services to individuals, households, and businesses. Services performed include: personal care services; death care services; laundry and drycleaning services; and a wide range of other personal services, such as pet care (except veterinary) services, photofinishing services, temporary parking services, and dating services.

oneOf.title: Religious, Grantmaking, Civic, Professional, and Similar Organizations
oneOf.description: This subsector comprises establishments that organize and promote religious activities; support various causes through grantmaking; advocate (promote or defend) causes; and provide other types of social, community, and professional services.

oneOf.title: Private Households
oneOf.description: This industry comprises private households primarily engaged in employing workers on or about the premises in activities primarily concerned with the operation of the household. These private households may employ individuals, such as cooks, maids, nannies, butlers, non-medical personal care aides, and outside workers, such as gardeners, caretakers, and other maintenance workers.

oneOf.title: Executive, Legislative, and Other General Government Support
oneOf.description: The Executive, Legislative, and Other General Government Support subsector groups offices of government executives, legislative bodies, public finance, and general government support. Offices within this subsector are charged with implementing government policies, administering government programs, overseeing the execution of laws and regulations, and other governmental functions.

oneOf.title: Justice, Public Order, and Safety Activities
oneOf.description: The Justice, Public Order, and Safety Activities subsector groups government establishments engaged in the administration of justice, public order, and safety programs.

oneOf.title: Administration of Human Resource Programs
oneOf.description: This industry comprises government establishments primarily engaged in the planning, administration, and coordination of programs for public assistance, social work, and welfare activities. The administration of Social Security, disability insurance, Medicare, unemployment insurance, and workers' compensation programs are included in this industry.

oneOf.title: Administration of Environmental Quality Programs
oneOf.description: The Administration of Environmental Quality Programs subsector groups government establishments primarily engaged in the administration of environmental quality, including the administration, regulation, and enforcement of air and water resource programs; the administration and regulation of solid waste management programs; and the administration and regulation of water and air pollution control and prevention programs.

oneOf.title: Administration of Housing Programs, Urban Planning, and Community Development
oneOf.description: The Administration of Housing Programs, Urban Planning, and Community Development subsector groups government establishments primarily engaged in the administration of housing, urban planning, and community development. This includes the administration and planning of housing programs and the administration and planning of the development of urban and rural areas.

oneOf.title: Administration of Economic Programs
oneOf.description: The Administration of Economic Programs subsector groups government establishments primarily engaged in the administration of economic programs that affect areas such as business, industry, and tourism. The subsector includes the development of general statistical data and analyses and the promotion of the general economic well-being of the governed area.

oneOf.title: Space Research and Technology
oneOf.description: The Space Research and Technology subsector comprises government establishments primarily engaged in the administration and operations of space flights, space research, and space exploration. This includes government establishments operating space flight centers.

oneOf.title: National Security
oneOf.description: This industry comprises government establishments of the Armed Forces, including the National Guard, primarily engaged in national security and related activities.

oneOf.title: International Affairs
oneOf.description: This industry comprises establishments of U.S. and foreign governments primarily engaged in international affairs and programs relating to other nations and peoples.

oneOf.title: Beneficiary
oneOf.description: The organization accepted trade secrets, customer lists, intellectual property, etc. that the insider obtained through the incident.

oneOf.title: Primary Victim
oneOf.description: The organization was the primary victim organization of the insider's actions.

oneOf.title: Secondary Victim
oneOf.description: The organization was a secondary victim to the incident. E.g., An organization that relied on the primary victim's services in order to conduct their business.

oneOf.title: Trusted Business Partner
oneOf.description: The organization has an alliance (contractually, bonded, etc.) with the victim organization.

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other role not described by this vocabulary.

json\\objects\\person.title: Person
json\\objects\\person.description: This is an abstract class for inheritance by the Insider and Accomplice objects. Person describes the properties of an individual that MAY be inherited by those classes.

first_name.description: The first or given name of the individual

middle_name.description: The middle name of the individual

last_name.description: The last or family name of the individual

suffix.description: The name suffix of the individual

alias.description: A list of aliases (other names) the individual has used or the anonymized name of the individual in court records

city.description: The city (or county or district) that the person resided in at the time of the incident

state.description: The state (or region) that the person resided in at the time of the incident

country.description: The country that the person resided in at the time of the incident. Public implementations should use the standard codes provided by ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

postal_code.description: The postal code that the person resided in at the time of the incident

country_of_citizenship.description: Citizenship(s) of the person. Public implementations should use the standard codes provided by ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

nationality.description: The nationality or nationalities of the person. Public implementations should use the standard codes provided by ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

residency.description: Residency status if the person was not a citizen of the country where they resided during the incident

gender.description: Sex or gender at the time of the incident

age.description: Age at the time that the incident began

education.description: Highest level of education at the time the incident began

marital_status.description: The marital status at the time of the incident

number_of_children.description: The number of children that the person is responsible for at the time of the incident

comment.description: Comments or clarifications regarding any of the Person properties

oneOf.title: Junior
oneOf.description: A suffix denoting the son of the father with the same name

oneOf.title: Senior
oneOf.description: A suffix denoting the father when the son has the same name

oneOf.title: The Third
oneOf.description: A suffix denoting the third generation with the same name

oneOf.title: The Fourth
oneOf.description: A suffix denoting the fourth generation with the same name

oneOf.title: Naturalized
oneOf.description: A formerly non-citizen that has undergone naturalization and become a citizen

oneOf.title: Permanent Resident
oneOf.description: A foreign citizen who is a permitted to live in a country they are not a citizen of indefinitely

oneOf.title: Resident Alien
oneOf.description: A foreign citizen who is a resident of a country they are not a citizen of

oneOf.title: Female
oneOf.description: Female

oneOf.title: Male
oneOf.description: Male

oneOf.title: Non-binary
oneOf.description: Non-binary

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other

oneOf.title: Associates Degree
oneOf.description: Possessing an undergraduate degree at the associates level

oneOf.title: Bachelors Degree
oneOf.description: Possessing an undegraduate degree at the bachelors level

oneOf.title: Doctorate
oneOf.description: Possesing a graduate degree at the doctoral level

oneOf.title: High School Diploma or GED
oneOf.description: Possessing a high school diploma or general education development (GED)

oneOf.title: Masters Degree
oneOf.description: Possessing a graduate degree at the masters level

oneOf.title: Professional Degree
oneOf.description: Possessing a degree making one qualified for a particular profession

oneOf.title: Some College
oneOf.description: Having completed some amount of collegiate coursework but not possessing a degree

oneOf.title: Some High School
oneOf.description: Having completed some amount of high school coursework but not possessing a high school diploma

oneOf.title: Single
oneOf.description: Not currently married

oneOf.title: Married
oneOf.description: Currently belonging to a marriage or common law partnership with a spouse who is an intimate partner

oneOf.title: Divorced
oneOf.description: Having legally exited a previous marriage

oneOf.title: Separated
oneOf.description: Married but no longer in an intimate partnership with a spouse

oneOf.title: Widowed/Widower
oneOf.description: Previously in a marriage that ended due to the death of their spouse

json\\objects\\response.title: Response
json\\objects\\response.description: Response describes the organization's response to the incident, including technical and behavioral controls, investigation, and legal response. An incident may have only one response entity. A response may have only one legal response entity.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "response--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

technical_controls.description: Controls put in place to limit or monitor the insider's access to devices, data, or the network or to limit or monitor network or device access for the user population more generally

behavioral_controls.description: Controls put in place to limit, monitor, or correct the insider's behavior within the organization

investigated_by.description: The organization(s) or entity(s) that investigated the incident

investigation_events.description: Specific events that happened during the course of the investigation into the incident

comment.description: Clarifying comments or additional details about the organization's response

oneOf.title: Access to Technical System(s) Restricted
oneOf.description: Insider's access to the organization's technical systems is restricted in any capacity (e.g., the organization declares that insider could only log onto system if another employee is present)

oneOf.title: Access to Technical System(s) Terminated
oneOf.description: Insider's access to the organization's technical systems is completely terminated (e.g., the insider's account is deleted upon termination from the company)

oneOf.title: Counseling
oneOf.description: Insider is sent to counseling of any kind as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Demoted
oneOf.description: Insider is demoted (.g., reduced their rank, title, or responsbilities)

oneOf.title: Passed Over For Promotion
oneOf.description: Organization chooses to promote someone other than the insider as a result of the insider's actions

oneOf.title: Poor Performance Review
oneOf.description: Insider receives a review of their work performance which is deemed below average

oneOf.title: Put on Paid/Unpaid Leave
oneOf.description: Insider is put on temporary leave from a job assignment, with or without pay and benefits

oneOf.title: Referred to Employee Assistance Program
oneOf.description: Insider is referred to the EAP as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Reported to HR
oneOf.description: Insider is reported to Human Resources as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Suspended
oneOf.description: Insider is suspended (definitely or indefinitely) and not allowed to conduct normal work for the organization

oneOf.title: Terminated
oneOf.description: Insider is terminated, or fired, from the organization

oneOf.title: Transferred
oneOf.description: Insider is transferred to another company location as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Verbal Reprimand
oneOf.description: Insider receives a verbal reprimand from their supervisor as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Written Reprimand
oneOf.description: Insider receives a written reprimand from their supervisor as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Evidence Found
oneOf.description: Evidence relevant to the incident is found (e.g., fellow employee found a USB drive left in the insider's computer that had sensitive company files downloaded on to it)

oneOf.title: Insider Admits to Activity in Interview
oneOf.description: Insider admits to involvement in insider incident while being interviewed by investigators about the incident (or related activity)

oneOf.title: Insider's Residence/Workplace Searched
oneOf.description: Investigators search the insider's home or workplace for evidence related to the incident

oneOf.title: Case Opened Internally
oneOf.description: The victim organization open a case to investigate the insider

oneOf.title: Case Opened with Law Enforcement
oneOf.description: Law enforcement opened a case to investigate the insider

oneOf.title: Insider Interviewed
oneOf.description: Insider is interviewed about the incident by investigators

oneOf.title: Incident Response Team
oneOf.description: Incident Response Team (IRT), whether internal to the organization or provided by an external contract

oneOf.title: Internal Investigators
oneOf.description: Other investigators internal to the victim organization

oneOf.title: Law Enforcement - Federal
oneOf.description: Federal law enforcement entity such as the FBI or USSS

oneOf.title: Law Enforcement - Government Agency
oneOf.description: Law enforcement belonging to a government agency such as DHS, USPS, or the IRS

oneOf.title: Law Enforcement - Local/State
oneOf.description: State or local law enforcement entity

oneOf.title: Law Enforcement - Military/DoD
oneOf.description: Law enforcement belonging to the military or Department of Defense such as military police or NCIS

oneOf.title: Management
oneOf.description: Management internal to the organization

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other investigator not lised in this vocabulary

json\\objects\\sentence.title: Sentence
json\\objects\\sentence.description: Generally, sentence is the amount of punishment for an offense. It could refer to the term of imprisonment or probation, the amount of fines imposed on a convicted defendant for criminal wrongdoing, or the amount of damages imposed for civil cases. Generally, the amount of punishment for an offense. A sentence must be connected to only one court case. A court case may have one or more sentences.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "sentence--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

sentence_type.description: The type of sentence that was ordered

quantity.description: The quantity of the sentence type imposed. MUST be used with the `metric` property if used

metric.description: The measurement type of the sentence imposed. MUST be used with the `quantity` property if used

concurrency.description: Whether the sentence is to run concurrently (at the same time as) other sentences within the same case

oneOf.title: Assessment/Special Assessment
oneOf.description: A type of fine that always applies to each count of a convicted crime

oneOf.title: Community Service
oneOf.description: Unpaid work that benefits the community

oneOf.title: Damages
oneOf.description: An attempt to measure in financial terms the extent of harm a plaintiff has suffered because of the defendant's actions. Damges can be compensatory, punative, or statutory, and are usually attached to civil cases.

oneOf.title: Deportation
oneOf.description: Defendant is ordered to leave the country where the case is being tried

oneOf.title: Drug Testing
oneOf.description: Regular screening ordered to test for drugs

oneOf.title: Fine
oneOf.description: A financial punishment for violating a criminal law. Usually attached to criminal cases rather than civil.

oneOf.title: Forfeiture
oneOf.description: Loss of property, right, or privilege without compensation

oneOf.title: House Arrest
oneOf.description: Confinement to a particular location for the duration of the sentence

oneOf.title: Incarceration
oneOf.description: Imprisonment

oneOf.title: Injunction/Restraining Order
oneOf.description: Defendant is ordered to cease a particular action (e.g., using stolen IP in their business)

oneOf.title: Mental Health Treatment
oneOf.description: Defendant is ordered to an inpatient or outpatient mental health facility or is ordered to attend therapy for mental health issues

oneOf.title: No Internet Access
oneOf.description: Defendant is not allowed to access the Internet via any type of device

oneOf.title: Probation
oneOf.description: Defendant is released into the community in lieu of a prison sentence, but is subject to sepcial conditions and restrictions such as other types of sentences in this vocabulary

oneOf.title: Restitution
oneOf.description: An attempt to measure in financial terms the extent of the gains or profits the defendant obtained through harming the victim

oneOf.title: Substance Abuse Treatment
oneOf.description: Defendant is ordered to attend inpatient or outpatient treatment for substance abuse issues

oneOf.title: Supervised Release
oneOf.description: Defendant is released into the community, subject to special conditions and restrictions, after the completion of a prison sentence

oneOf.title: Hour(s)
oneOf.description: Imposed sentence is in terms of hours (e.g. 20 hours community service)

oneOf.title: Day(s)
oneOf.description: Imposed sentence is in terms of days (e.g. 30 days in a substance abuse treatment facility)

oneOf.title: Month(s)
oneOf.description: Imposed sentence is in terms of months (e.g. 18 months imprisonment)

oneOf.title: Year(s)
oneOf.description: Imposed sentence is in terms of years (e.g. five years no Internet access)

oneOf.title: Dollar(s)
oneOf.description: Imposed sentence is in terms of dollars (e.g. $10,000 in damages)

json\\objects\\source.title: Source
json\\objects\\source.description: Source describes a document that provides information about one or more aspects of the incident.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "source--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

source_type.description: The "source" or author of the source document

date.description: The date the document was created or most recently modified

public.description: Whether the document is publicly available

document.description: A pointer to the document itself, whether a file path, location, URL, or document object

oneOf.title: Court Document
oneOf.description: Legal document from a court case

oneOf.title: DOJ Press Release
oneOf.description: Press release from the Department of Justice or U.S. Attorneys' Office

oneOf.title: Investigator Notes
oneOf.description: Raw notes from an incident investigator

oneOf.title: Logs
oneOf.description: Technical logs from network, server, or user devices

oneOf.title: Media
oneOf.description: News, blog, or similar publication

oneOf.title: Organization Interview
oneOf.description: Direct interview with the victim organization

oneOf.title: Insider Interview
oneOf.description: Direct interview with the insider

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other type of source not listed in this vocabulary

oneOf.title: HTML File
oneOf.description: A file in HTML format

oneOf.title: Log File
oneOf.description: A log file containing technical event or transaction logs

oneOf.title: PDF File
oneOf.description: A file in Portable Document Format

oneOf.title: Text File
oneOf.description: A plain text file

oneOf.title: DOCX File
oneOf.description: A Microsoft Word document

oneOf.title: PNG Image
oneOf.description: An image file in PNG format

oneOf.title: Excel File
oneOf.description: A Microsoft Excel spreadsheet

oneOf.title: Video File
oneOf.description: A video file

oneOf.title: Other File
oneOf.description: A file of another type not listed in this vocabulary

json\\objects\\sponsor.title: Sponsor
json\\objects\\sponsor.description: A sponsor is an individual or entity that recruited, instigated, motivated, or otherwise supported the insider's action. A sponsor MUST be associated with at least one insider or accomplice. The sponsor may be associated with multiple insiders or accomplices.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "sponsor--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

name.description: The name of the individual or entity sponsoring the insider's actions

oneOf.title: Organized Crime
oneOf.description: E.g., terrorist group, mafia, gang

oneOf.title: State Sponsor
oneOf.description: Geopolitical, state, or national military with a speciific country of origin

oneOf.title: Foreign National
oneOf.description: An individual whose objectives are aligned with either the political, commercial, or military interests of a country other than where the incident originated

oneOf.title: Criminal Enterprise
oneOf.description: A group of individuals with an identified hierarchy or structure who engage in significant criminal activity

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: A sponsor type not listed in this vocabulary

json\\objects\\stressor.title: Stressor
json\\objects\\stressor.description: A sressor is an event(s) that occurred within the victim organization and precipitated insider activity.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "stressor--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

date.description: The date the stressor first occurred

category.description: The category to which the stressor belongs

subcategory.description: The subcategory to which the stressor belongs. When subcategory is specified, category MUST also be specified. The subcategory constant MUST map to the specified category constant.

oneOf.title: Employment Status
oneOf.description: The insider's employment status changed

oneOf.title: Organizational Issues
oneOf.description: The insider's employer had problems or changes that directly or indirectly affected the insider

oneOf.title: Unmet Expectations
oneOf.description: Insider's expectations of their employer were not met

oneOf.title: Consequences for Previous Violations
oneOf.description: Consequences against the insider resulting from the insider's previous behavior or violations, not resulting from the incident itself

oneOf.title: Insider Hired
oneOf.description: Insider is hired by the victim organization or another organization

oneOf.title: Insider Promoted
oneOf.description: The insider is promoted within any organization, including the victim organization

oneOf.title: Insider Demoted
oneOf.description: The insider is demoted within any organization, including the victim organization

oneOf.title: Insider Notified of Pending Termination
oneOf.description: The insider is informed that they will be terminated from the organization in the near future

oneOf.title: Insider Suspended
oneOf.description: The insider is suspended from work for any reason

oneOf.title: Insider Laid Off
oneOf.description: The insider is laid off from their position within the organization

oneOf.title: Insider Put on Paid/Unpaid Leave
oneOf.description: The insider is put on a temporary leave from a job assignment, with or without pay and benefits

oneOf.title: Insider Terminated
oneOf.description: The insider is fired from any organization, including the victim organization

oneOf.title: Insider Resigned
oneOf.description: The insider resigns from any organization, including the victim organization

oneOf.title: Change of Employment Status
oneOf.description: The insider's status within the organization changes from what it originally was (e.g., the insider took a full-time position at the organization after graduating college)

oneOf.title: Insider Changed Positions Internally
oneOf.description: The insider changes positions within the organization (e.g., the insider transferred to the accounting department)

oneOf.title: Insider Submits Resignation Notice
oneOf.description: The insider submits notice of resignation to the organization.

oneOf.title: Mergers And Acquisitions
oneOf.description: A change in the structure of the insider's employer organization (e.g., the insider's organization was in the process of being bought out by another company)

oneOf.title: Reorganization Of Organization Or Outsourcing
oneOf.description: A change in the internal structure of the insider's employer (e.g., the division of the victim organization that the insider worked in was closing)

oneOf.title: Significant Financial Stress (non-bankruptcy)
oneOf.description: The organization was undergoing significant financial stress, but did not declare bankruptcy

oneOf.title: Previous Insider Incident
oneOf.description: Organization has previously had an insider incident unrelated to this one

oneOf.title: Layoffs
oneOf.description: Temporary suspension or permanent termination of one or more employees

oneOf.title: Personnel Changes
oneOf.description: Staffing changes of employees other than the insider within the employing organization

oneOf.title: Supervisor Ambiguity
oneOf.description: The insider expressed a lack of clarity in the organization's supervisory hierarchy

oneOf.title: Organization Filed for Bankruptcy
oneOf.description: The organization filed for bankruptcy

oneOf.title: Lack of Background Checks
oneOf.description: The organizational failure to sufficiently review the past history of potential candidates

oneOf.title: Inadequate Training
oneOf.description: An organizational failure to administer the proper training for its employees

oneOf.title: Lax Controls
oneOf.description: The organizational failure to restrict access to what is necessary for the insider to perform work related activities

oneOf.title: Hostile Work Environment
oneOf.description: A work environment that is difficult or uncomfortable for another person to work in due to discrimination of any kind

oneOf.title: Problematic Leader
oneOf.description: A supervisor or other leader who is abusive or difficult to work with, for example, by ignoring input from subordinates, excessively criticizing, or taking credit for subordinates' work.

oneOf.title: Compensation/Benefit Issues
oneOf.description: Insider expressed dissatisfaction with current compensation or benefits

oneOf.title: Poor Performance Review
oneOf.description: Insider received a review of their work performance that was deemed below average

oneOf.title: Request Denied By Organization
oneOf.description: The employing organization refused a request rom the insider (e.g., the insider's request to work from home is denied due to unproductivity in past work from home).

oneOf.title: Passed Over For Promotion
oneOf.description: Insider's employer chooses to promote someone other than the insider

oneOf.title: Counseling
oneOf.description: Insider was sent to counseling of any kind as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Referred to EAP
oneOf.description: Insider was referred to the Employee Assistance Program (EAP) as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Reported to HR
oneOf.description: Insider was reported to human resources as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Transferred
oneOf.description: Insider was transferred to another location or another team as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Verbal Reprimand
oneOf.description: Insider received a verbal reprimand from their supervisor as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Written Reprimand
oneOf.description: Insider received a written reprimand from their supervisor as a result of their actions

json\\objects\\target.title: Target
json\\objects\\target.description: Target describes the system, data, person, or physical property that was targeted by the insider. An incident may have many targets.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "target--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

category.description: The classification group a target belongs to

subcategory.description: The lower level classification group a target belongs to

format.description: The data type of the target

owner.description: Who the data is about. For assets, the owner of the asset. In cases where the owner and subject of the data or asset is unclear, pick the person or group most responsible for safeguarding the data or asset.

sensitivity.description: The level of sensitivity and controls applied to a target

oneOf.title: Facilities
oneOf.description: Buildings, offices, areas of buildings, or functions of buildings (such as disabling a door)

oneOf.title: Information
oneOf.description: Data or business materials that contain important details belonging to a specific target owner

oneOf.title: Money
oneOf.description: Currency, digital or physical, or materials, goods, or data that will be converted to currency or are currency equivalent

oneOf.title: People
oneOf.description: Employees, customers, individuals

oneOf.title: Technology
oneOf.description: Hardware, software, or firmware intended for the storage or transmission of data or the operation of equipment (as in computers running a manufacturing line)

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other asset type not listed in this vocabulary

oneOf.title: Physical Property - Non-digital assets
oneOf.description: Physical property such as material goods or office furnishings

oneOf.title: Product Information
oneOf.description: Information about products or services the organization sells

oneOf.title: Business Plans
oneOf.description: Data or documents having to do with the everyday course of the business

oneOf.title: Government/Law Enforcement Information
oneOf.description: Classified or sensitive government or law enforcement information

oneOf.title: Money
oneOf.description: Currency, digital or physical, or materials, goods, or data that will be converted to currency or are currency equivalent

oneOf.title: Customer Data
oneOf.description: Information provided by customers or describing customers

oneOf.title: Employee Data
oneOf.description: Information collected from employees or describing employees

oneOf.title: Identification
oneOf.description: Digital or physical means of verifying identity

oneOf.title: Medical Information
oneOf.description: Information about an individuals' Protected Health Information (PHI) such as Medicare/Medicaid or prescription medications

oneOf.title: Person(s)
oneOf.description: Individual person or persons

oneOf.title: Network or Systems
oneOf.description: Platforms in which information is shared or processes are run

oneOf.title: Software
oneOf.description: Software or applications running on the organization's devices or systems

oneOf.title: Passwords
oneOf.description: Text strings which authenticate access to a system

oneOf.title: Communication Systems
oneOf.description: Servers, routers, phone systems, etc. that enable communication within the organization or between the organization and external entities

oneOf.title: Unknown
oneOf.description: Unclear what was targeted

oneOf.title: Blueprint Plans
oneOf.description: Schematics for facility layout, products, or devices

oneOf.title: Facilities
oneOf.description: Buildings, offices, areas of buildings, or functions of buildings (such as disabling a door)

oneOf.title: Physical Products
oneOf.description: Tangible objects owned or managed by the organization

oneOf.title: Product Information
oneOf.description: Information about products or services offered by the organization

oneOf.title: Proprietary Information
oneOf.description: Information that gives the organization a competitive advantage, such as trade secrets, formulas, designs, or processes which could be exposed or sold to a competitor

oneOf.title: Business Plans
oneOf.description: Pitches or anything having to do with the everyday course of business

oneOf.title: Business System
oneOf.description: System which the organization requires to operate the business

oneOf.title: Commerce information
oneOf.description: Data related to the organization's business dealings, such as customer lists, pricing strategies, supplier contracts, or marketing plans

oneOf.title: Contract Information
oneOf.description: Information related to legal agreements made between the organization and other organizations or individuals such as employees or contractors

oneOf.title: Design and Plans
oneOf.description: Product design or information for a business plan

oneOf.title: Payroll Information
oneOf.description: Data relating to employee salaries, benefits, and tax information

oneOf.title: Classified Information
oneOf.description: Information that is restricted by the government for reasons of national security

oneOf.title: Sensitive Information
oneOf.description: Data that could cause harm to the organization or its stakeholders if leaked or misused

oneOf.title: Accounting Records
oneOf.description: Records tracking money, inventory, or purchases

oneOf.title: ATM Withdrawal
oneOf.description: Money that withdrawn from an ATM

oneOf.title: Bank Account Information
oneOf.description: Bank account information for a peculiar person or entity

oneOf.title: Bitcoin
oneOf.description: Money in the form of virtual currency

oneOf.title: Company Funds
oneOf.description: Monetary assets used for financing operations and initiatives of the organization

oneOf.title: Gift Cards
oneOf.description: Money in the form of prepaid debit cards for use at a specific vendor

oneOf.title: Invoices
oneOf.description: Money in the form of receiving funds from fraudulent invoices

oneOf.title: Issued Checks
oneOf.description: Money in the form of receiving funds from fraudulent checks

oneOf.title: Loan
oneOf.description: Money in the form of temporary funds given with the expectation of being repaid with interest

oneOf.title: Physical Currency
oneOf.description: Money in the form of tangible paper bills, coins, or other means of circulation that holds direct monetary value

oneOf.title: Refunds
oneOf.description: Money in the form of reimbursements for returend goods or services

oneOf.title: Reimbursement Forms
oneOf.description: Information related to reports of incurred transaction expenses

oneOf.title: Tax Information
oneOf.description: Tax forms, documentation, or identifiers

oneOf.title: Time Sheets
oneOf.description: Digital or analog forms for employees to report hours worked

oneOf.title: Client List
oneOf.description: Listing of organizations or individuals which are provided services by the organization

oneOf.title: Customer Data
oneOf.description: Information about customers or provided by customers

oneOf.title: Immigration Records
oneOf.description: Records of individuals who are unaturalized immigrants

oneOf.title: Credit Card Information
oneOf.description: Information relating to a credit card such as the card number, the cardholder's name, when the card expires, and the card's security code

oneOf.title: Insurance Claims
oneOf.description: Information relating to monetary claims made in request to an insurance policy

oneOf.title: Employee Data
oneOf.description: Information about employees or belonging to employees of an organization

oneOf.title: Driver's license
oneOf.description: Information related to a legal identification that provides a permit to operate a motor vehicle

oneOf.title: Personal Photos
oneOf.description: Images of a personal nature or unrelated to the organization's business

oneOf.title: PII
oneOf.description: Sensitive information that can be used to identify an individual

oneOf.title: PHI
oneOf.description: Sensitive information that is indicative of an individual's health condition

oneOf.title: Medicare/Medicaid
oneOf.description: Information related to health insurance provided by the state to the elderly or financially limited populations

oneOf.title: Prescription Medication
oneOf.description: Iinformation that relates to doctors notes permiting the purchase of controlled medical substances

oneOf.title: Prescription Pads
oneOf.description: Secured stationery notes that doctors use for writing prescriptions

oneOf.title: Self
oneOf.description: The insider is targeting themself

oneOf.title: Others
oneOf.description: Indivdual or individuals other than the insider

oneOf.title: Backup Data
oneOf.description: Data that can be used to restore a system or dataset if it becomes compromised

oneOf.title: Backup Tapes
oneOf.description: Stored backup data copied to a tape cartridge

oneOf.title: Database
oneOf.description: Structured electronic digital information repository

oneOf.title: Email Servers
oneOf.description: Systems used to host and deliver email services

oneOf.title: FTP Servers
oneOf.description: Systems which allow the exchange of files between two or more computers

oneOf.title: Network Configuration
oneOf.description: Routing or network access configuration

oneOf.title: Network Login Information
oneOf.description: Information related to access credentials for a network

oneOf.title: Servers
oneOf.description: System(s) which host information or digital services for end users

oneOf.title: Website Hosting
oneOf.description: System(s) for delivering websites over the internet

oneOf.title: Backup Software
oneOf.description: Software designed to create copies of data for safe storage

oneOf.title: Software Policy Protocol
oneOf.description: Rules developed by an organization for the ideal deployment of a software

oneOf.title: Source code
oneOf.description: Underlying codebase for a product or system

oneOf.title: Unreleased Software
oneOf.description: Software that has not yet been made available

oneOf.title: Login Information
oneOf.description: Credentials used for access to a technological system

oneOf.title: Passwords
oneOf.description: Access credentials in the form of a text string

oneOf.title: Emails
oneOf.description: Electronic communications in the form of static messages shared to specified user addresses via a network

oneOf.title: Telecommunication Systems
oneOf.description: Networks that facilitate digital or voice communications

oneOf.title: Electronic
oneOf.description: Technological digital format

oneOf.title: Physical
oneOf.description: Tangible real-world format

oneOf.title: Personnel
oneOf.description: People or individuals

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other format not listed in this vocabulary

oneOf.title: Unknown
oneOf.description: Unclear what was targeted

oneOf.title: Consumer
oneOf.description: An individual that purchases and makes use of a product or service

oneOf.title: Employee
oneOf.description: An individual internal to an organization who facilitates the disbursement of products or services

oneOf.title: Organization
oneOf.description: The organization, rather than its employees or customers, owns the target

oneOf.title: Third Party
oneOf.description: Parties external to an organization and consumers

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other owner not listed in this vocabulary

oneOf.title: Unclassified
oneOf.description: No classification

oneOf.title: Confidential
oneOf.description: Public disclosure would damage national security

oneOf.title: FOUO
oneOf.description: For official use only

oneOf.title: Secret
oneOf.description: Public disclosure would cause serious damage to national security

oneOf.title: SecretNoForn
oneOf.description: Secret / restricted to country of source

oneOf.title: Top Secret (TS)
oneOf.description: Top secret - unauthorized disclosure would cause exceptionally grave damage to national security

oneOf.title: TS/SCI
oneOf.description: Top secret / Sensitive compartmented information

oneOf.title: NATORestricted
oneOf.description: North Atlantic Treaty Organization Restricted

oneOf.title: NATOConfidential
oneOf.description: North Atlantic Treaty Organization Confidential

oneOf.title: NATOSecret
oneOf.description: North Atlantic Treaty Organization Secret

oneOf.title: CosmicTopSecret
oneOf.description: Top Secret documents managed by a COSMIC registry

oneOf.title: FVEYProprietary
oneOf.description: Five eyes proprietary

oneOf.title: Proprietary
oneOf.description: Information a company wishes to keep confidential (e.g. trade secrets)

oneOf.title: Personal identifiable information (PII)
oneOf.description: Information which can be used to distinguish or trace an individual's identity, such as their name, social security number, biometric records, etc. alone, or when combined with other personal or identifying information which is linked or linkable to a specific individual, such as date and place of birth, mother's maiden name, etc.

oneOf.title: HIPPA/Protected Health Information (PHI)
oneOf.description: Individually identifiable health information, held or maintained by a covered entity or its business associates acting for the covered entity, that is transmitted or maintained in any form or medium. This includes identifiable demographic and other information relating to the past, present, or future physical or mental health or condition of an individual, or the provision or payment of health care to an individual that is created or received by a health care provider, health plan, employer, or health care clearinghouse.

oneOf.title: GDPR
oneOf.description: General data protection regulation

oneOf.title: Public
oneOf.description: Unrestricted/open to the public

oneOf.title: CUI
oneOf.description: Controlled Unclassified Information

oneOf.title: Controlled Technical Information (CTI)
oneOf.description: Technical information subject to controls to access, use, reproduction, or dissemination

oneOf.title: FERPA (student education records)
oneOf.description: Information subject to sensitity due to relevance to student educational privacy

oneOf.title: Federal Tax Information (FTI)
oneOf.description: Information that subject to sensitivty that is derived from tax returns

oneOf.title: Government Sensitive
oneOf.description: Classified or sensitive information used by and only available to the government

oneOf.title: Intellectual Property (IP)
oneOf.description: Information that has been created and is subject to protection of its creativity

oneOf.title: Law Enforcement Sensitive
oneOf.description: Information, software, or device used by and only available to law enforcement

oneOf.title: Non-Public
oneOf.description: Information not made available to the public

oneOf.title: Credit/Payment Card (PCI)
oneOf.description: Credit/payment card information
